snippet: The hostile reception by farmers for Daw Aung San Suu Kyi underscores the rockiness of her transition from international symbol to elected official.
abstract: Hundreds of angry farmers heckle and walk out on Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, Burmese politician and Nobel laureate, during her visit to villages in central Myanmar to encourage residents to cease protests and cede their land to copper mine; hostile reception underscores rockiness of her transition from international symbol to elected official.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe contributed reporting from Monywa, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: The hostile reception by farmers for Daw Aung San Suu Kyi underscores the rockiness of her transition from international symbol to elected official.

headline.seo: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi Heckled Over Support of Mine in Myanmar
headline.main: Burmese Laureate Heckled Over Backing Copper Mine
headline.print_headline: Burmese Laureate Heckled Over Backing Copper Mine
